intro: Eriogonum domitum, commonly known as the desert gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is well adapted to arid environments. It has slender, branched stems and small, ovate leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Eriogonum domitum plays an important role in supporting pollinators and is often found in sagebrush steppe and desert scrub habitats.
